intro: Apocopis pallidus, commonly known as the pale grasshopper plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Apocopis pallidus is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various insects and pollinators.
